Constructs Bitfield object with value 0

Constructs Bitfield object with indicated value

uint64 bitfield value

Default destructor for the Bitfield object

Variables
m_value
uint64 m_value

The bitfield value

Functions
value
uint64 value() const

Gets or sets the entire underlying bitfield value

get
uint64 get(
uint64 
mask,
bool 
shiftToLsb
 = 
true
) const

Gets the value of only the bits masked by the indicated mask.

Parameters
mask
uint64

uint64 indicating which bits to evaluate

shiftToLsb
bool

true: return the masked bits shifted all the way to the right, false: return the masked bits in their original position

Returns
uint64

the masked value

set
void set(
uint64 
mask,
uint64 
value,
bool 
shiftRequired
 = 
true
)

Sets the provided value to the position indicated by the indicated mask

Parameters
mask
uint64

uint64 indicating the position to place the value

value
uint64

uint64 value to set

shiftRequired
bool

true: provided value needs to be shifted to the masked position before being set, false: provided value already in the correct position within the bitfield

checkBit
bool checkBit(
uint8 
bitIndex,
uint8 
indexBase
 = 
0
) const

Gets the value of the bit at the specified index.

Parameters
bitIndex
uint8

index of the bit to check

indexBase
uint8

default 0 - index of the first bit, this will be subtracted from bitIndex to get the 0-based index to use.  This is useful if each bit is associated with sequential IDs that are not 0-based (i.e. inertial GPIO pin IDs).

Returns
bool

true if bit is 1, false if 0

setBit
void setBit(
uint8 
bitIndex,
bool 
value,
uint8 
indexBase
 = 
0
)

Sets the value of the bit at the specified index.

Parameters
bitIndex
uint8

index of the bit to set

value
bool

bool value to set

indexBase
uint8

default 0 - index of the first bit, this will be subtracted from bitIndex to get the 0-based index to use.  This is useful if each bit is associated with sequential IDs that are not 0-based (i.e. inertial GPIO pin IDs).

clear
void clear(
uint64 
mask
)

Sets all bits under the indicated mask to 0.

Parameters
mask
uint64

uint64 mask indicating the position of the bits to clear
